tasks.task: Farming in the Upper Midwest and Addressing Environmental Issues

subtasks: Draining wetlands historically to create farmland
Maintain and manage tile drainage systems

tasks.task: Adapt Farming Practices to Reduce Pollution
subtasks: Apply fertilizers in bands to reduce leaching
Implement no-till or ridge-till practices to minimize soil erosion
Use cover crops and minimize residue removal to improve soil health
Identify and protect remaining prairie remnants
Restore and expand wetlands through conservation programs
Establish buffer strips and riparian forests to filter runoff
Preserve and manage prairie habitats for birds and butterflies
Create diverse landscapes with different microhabitats
Restore native vegetation to support insects and other wildlife
Participate in programs like CREP (Conservation Reserve Enhancement Program)
Coordinate conservation efforts across multiple properties
Monitor water quality and ecological impacts of farming practices

tasks.task: Minimize Nutrient Runoff to Gulf of Mexico
subtasks: Implement buffer systems to reduce sediment and nutrient loading
Conduct regular soil testing and adjust fertilizer application rates
Designate conservation margins and edge plantings to capture pollutants

tasks.task: Create Farming Systems Compatible with Conservation
subtasks: Integrate bird-friendly practices into agricultural operations
Design crops and rotations that support nesting and feeding of wildlife
Use precision agriculture techniques to optimize inputs and minimize environmental impact
